subject: Communication
title: Viral Stories: Why Some Ideas Spread
description: A quick, practical guide to Viral Stories: Why Some Ideas Spread.

hook.text: The Ice Bucket Challenge raised $115 million. A weird internet dare outperformed decades of traditional fundraising.

buildup.text: Jonah Berger identified six drivers of virality: Social currency, Triggers, Emotion, Public, Practical value, Stories.

discovery.text: The most shared content wraps a useful or emotional message inside a narrative that people want to retell.

twist.text: High-arousal emotions (awe, anger, anxiety) spread faster than low-arousal ones (sadness, contentment).

climax.text: Virality isn't random. It's engineering emotional intensity into a story that people feel compelled to pass on.

punchline.text: Stories go viral because people need to share how they feel.

quiz.question: What did Jonah Berger identify as drivers of virality?
options: Six factors including Social currency, Emotion, and Stories
